title: Who fought in the French and Indian war? - Quora
tags: The French and Indian War (Known commonly as the 7 Year's War)

response.answer_text: Colonists from Virginia under command of Lt. Col. George Washington led a small army up to Ft. Duquesne (Pittsburg, PA) where he came across a group of Imperial French soldiers and Native Americans, got into a battle, which caused the French Ambassador to get injured by gunshot. His commanding officer, Gen’l Braddock was killed. This was the start of what became the first real World War and it covered damn near every continent short of the polar caps. Britain came out the winner, but at a great cost which Parliament unsuccessfully tried to pass on to us. How’d that turn out? Britain and her Indian allies and French with hers.
